headline: T-Mobile's 5G to power Comcast, Charter wireless business plans
summary: Financial terms of the agreement were not disclosed.  As competition in broadband and pay TV intensifies, Comcast and Charter's new MVNO deal with T-Mobile underscores how the cable giants are seeking new growth opportunities by expanding into the business wireless market.

raw.headline: T-Mobile's 5G to power Comcast, Charter wireless business plans

headline: T-Mobile, Comcast, Charter Team Up on Mobile Services for Businesses
summary: Comcast and Charter Communications have agreed to use T-Mobile’s network to deliver mobile services to their business clients starting in 2026, the companies said.

raw.headline: T-Mobile, Comcast, Charter Team Up on Mobile Services for Businesses
raw.summary: Comcast and Charter Communications have agreed to use T-Mobile’s network to deliver mobile services to their business clients starting in 2026, the companies said.

headline: Charter and Comcast Announce Agreement to Leverage T-Mobile 5G for Wireless Business Customers
summary: PHILADELPHIA & STAMFORD, Conn. & BELLEVUE, Wash., July 22, 2025--Charter (NASDAQ: CHTR) and Comcast (NASDAQ: CMCSA) today announced they have entered into a multi-year exclusive agreement with T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS) to utilize its network to deliver mobile services to their business customers across the United States. Service is set to launch in 2026.

raw.headline: Charter and Comcast Announce Agreement to Leverage T-Mobile 5G for Wireless Business Customers
raw.summary: PHILADELPHIA & STAMFORD, Conn. & BELLEVUE, Wash., July 22, 2025--Charter (NASDAQ: CHTR) and Comcast (NASDAQ: CMCSA) today announced they have entered into a multi-year exclusive agreement with T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS) to utilize its network to deliver mobile services to their business customers across the United States. Service is set to launch in 2026.

headline: Three Video Streamers Top Netflix In Customer Satisfaction
summary: A U.S. consumer survey puts Netflix in fourth place for customer satisfaction among subscription streaming video services.

raw.headline: Three Video Streamers Top Netflix In Customer Satisfaction

headline: 'Superman' Flies Past $400 Million But Falters Overseas, While 'Jurassic World Rebirth' Charges Toward $650 Million In A Red-Hot Summer Box Office Battle
summary: As Hollywood's summer box office heats up, Warner Bros. Discovery’s (NASDAQ:WBD) “Superman” has crossed $400 million globally, while Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ:CMCSA) owned Universal's "Jurassic World Rebirth" is racing toward the $650 million mark. What Happened: After two weekends in theaters, Superman has generated $406 million worldwide, including $235 million from North America and $171.8 million internationally, reported Variety on Sunday.
